data.title: Driver monitoring gets spotlight amid safety questions
data.description: Two leaders in motor vehicle safety testing said Thursday that they will rate the driver monitoring systems that are supposed to help make technologies like Tesla's Autopilot safe.

data.title: Cramer advises investors to sell stocks in companies that don't make money
data.description: Investors should dump their stocks in companies that aren't profitable, CNBC's Jim Cramer said Thursday, one day after the Nasdaq entered correction territory.

data.title: IRS will soon require a selfie to access some of its online tools and applications
data.description: Starting summer 2022, the IRS is requiring taxpayers to create an account with identity verification company ID.me to access certain tools and applications.

data.title: Shares of autonomous driving tech company Luminar surge on Mercedes-Benz deal
data.description: As part of the agreement, Mercedes-Benz is expected to acquire up to 1.5 million shares of Luminar.

data.title: Cramer's Investing Club Stock Profile: From AI to gaming, this chipmaker is in all the right markets
data.description: Nearly every secular growth end market on the planet relies on the company's chips.

data.title: Amazon bets you're tired of just buying clothes off Amazon
data.description: Amazon has a new venture outside of e-commerce, cloud computing, content streaming, smart devices, Whole Foods, cashier-less technology or anything else you've come to associate with one of the most successful companies in American history.

data.title: Singapore's first SPAC debuts four months after rule change, closes 1% higher
data.description: The company, Vertex Technology Acquisition Corporation, is sponsored by Vertex Venture, a wholly owned subsidiary of state investor Temasek.
